creator: bill+apache@bfccomputing.com
text:
Not sure if this is mod_rewrite's fault or not, that's where I saw the symptom.

I was upgrading my 1.3 config to 2.0.40/redhat 9 errata (current as of yesterday).  

The rewrite rules weren't working at all, I couldn't even get a rewritelog
created with the loglevel at 9.  The rest of the virtualhost config was working
OK.  mod_rewrite shows on the server-info page, proper loadmodule directive, etc.

I moved the virtualhost config files from conf.d to conf and put an Include in
httpd.conf there, and everything immediately started working just as I'd expect.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
I have no idea what conf or conf.d is.  This must be some redhatism.  You
probably want to bring this up on a redhat forum.

Thanks for using Apache!

>I have no idea what conf or conf.d is.  This must be some redhatism.

Hardly surprising... just running the Redhat one to make my sysadmin happy...

Here's what conf.d is:

 httpd.conf:Include conf.d/*.conf

Still an apache issue, I think.  Updating summary to clarify.
creator: bill+apache@bfccomputing.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Please file a bug against the "httpd" package at
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/, and include the config fragment which
doesn't work correctly in the "conf.d" directory.

Back to "Invalid".

Certainly Apache doesn't care about the name of the directory, so this
is likely a configuration issue.  In any case, as Joe suggests,
you are better off in a Redhat forum where people know the setup
you are talking about.
creator: slive@apache.org
